perturbation.original_text: The Supplier wishes to appoint the Distributor as its non-exclusive distributor for the promotion and sale of the Products within the Territory (both as defined below), and the Distributor wishes to promote and sell the Products within the Territory on the terms of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Supplier wishes to appoint the Vendor as its non-exclusive distributor for the promotion and sale of the Products within the Territory (both as defined below), and the Distributor wishes to promote and sell the Products within the Territory on the terms of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Vendor'. This creates confusion as to who the 'Distributor' is actually referring to throughout the rest of the document, especially when referencing the obligations of the 'Distributor' because in the 'Background' section it references 'Vendor', creating ambiguity in enforcement and which party is responsible for the stated duties.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3 The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$'s within thirty (45) days of the date of invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 The Customer must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$'s within sixty (90) days of the date of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Customer,' and the payment period has been changed from "thirty (45) days" to "sixty (90) days." This introduces a contradiction regarding the payment terms as the agreement primarily refers to the 'Distributor.' This creates uncertainty about which payment term is enforceable, especially as 'Customer' is not a defined term.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Subject to the Distributor fulfilling all the conditions in this clause 10, the Supplier shall indemnify the Distributor, defend and hold harmless against any liability incurred by the Distributor in respect of damage to property, death or personal injury arising from any fault or defect in the design of the Products and any reasonable costs, claims, demands and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in connection with that liability (Relevant Claim), except to the extent the liability arises as a result of the wilful misconduct of the Distributor. The Supplier shall add the distributor to their current insurance certificate.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Subject to the Client fulfilling all the conditions in this clause 10, the Supplier shall indemnify the Distributor, defend and hold harmless against any liability incurred by the Distributor in respect of damage to property, death or personal injury arising from any fault or defect in the design of the Products and any reasonable costs, claims, demands and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in connection with that liability (Relevant Claim), except to the extent the liability arises as a result of the wilful misconduct of the Distributor. The Supplier shall add the distributor to their current insurance certificate.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Client.' This creates ambiguity and confusion, especially as there are specific conditions to fulfill. It is unclear who is responsible for what obligation and creates uncertainty and internal contradiction as to the conditions for insurance coverage or responsibility, especially because the rest of the text in Section 10.1 refers to 'Distributor',
